ygData.subject: Re: Re: Interesting Bug (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: Erm, actually, I think the smaller the race, the more ease they have in climbing things.  Like, if I had my halfling warrior go try to climb a wall or
ygData.messageBody:
Erm, actually, I think the smaller the race, the more ease they have in
climbing things. Like, if I had my halfling warrior go try to climb a wall
or something, and he would be able to do it easily, my ogre shaman might not
be able to do it at all, (of course, he could probably just jump and be on
top of it :)

Taluvil
----- Original Message -----
From: Robin Wise 3 <eurmali@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 01, 1999 6:16 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Interesting Bug (OT)


> From: "Robin Wise 3" <eurmali@...>
>
> >Another way of seeing 'behind the sets' is to get levitate
> >within Freeport and walk along the tops of the walls and on
> >top of the buildings.
>
> An easier way I found by accident: there's a tree in West Freeport, North
of
> the Monk's Guild, right by one of the walls (it's close to the stage that
> fills the corner of that square). If you climb to the top and leap, you
can
> just reach the wall. By running and leaping, you can get around to most
of
> the city walls and rooftops. The graphics there are unfinished, and I
have
> a nice overhead shot of me standing on the wall watching the moon rise
> BENEATH me - a bit vertiginous, that.
>
> OK, ok, I climb a lot, just to see what's up there.
>
> I don't know whether this is possible for you non-woodelves or not. My
> friend Bayrn, a high-elf cleric, tried over and over but couldn't climb to
> the top of the tree. I wonder whether we woodelves actually are better at
> climbing trees? = )
>
> Aloro (E'ci)
>
